page.title: 11MILL ENGINEERING COMPANY
page.content: This firm started in 1956 and has since 1975 occupied its present site of about 2 acres on the disused airfield in Ablington. The main repair shop and administrative offices are housed in one of the 3 old hangars, since repaired and re-roofed, the others being used for storage. The main function of the firm is the repair of agricultural machinery such as combine harvesters, bailers etc., most of which work is carried out in situ on farms. Spare parts are collected daily from Bury St. Edmunds and distributed all over the West of England. In addition, agricultural machinery is imported, mostly from Germany, for resale. The firm gives employment to about 23 people, most of whom live locally.
